item.title: Priscilla add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "It had flaws, but what does that matter when it comes to matters of the heart? We love what we love. Reason does not enter into it. In many ways, unwise love is the truest love. Anyone can love a thing <i>because</i>. That's as easy as putting a penny in your pocket. But to love something <i>despite</i>. To know the flaws and love them too. That is rare and pure and perfect." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Priscilla add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Priscilla add a quote by Nick Harkaway
item.description: "Privacy is a protection from the unreasonable use of state and corporate power. But that is, in a sense, a secondary thing. In the first instance, privacy is the statement in words of a simple understanding, which belongs to the instinctive world rather than the formal one, that some things are the province of those who experience them and not naturally open to the scrutiny of others: courtship and love, with their emotional nakedness; the simple moments of family life; the appalling rawness of grief. That the state and other systems are precluded from snooping on these things is important - it is a strong barrier between the formal world and the hearth, extended or not - but at root privacy is a simple understanding: not everything belongs to everyone." -- Nick Harkaway

item.title: Priscilla add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Sometimes I think that's where most of us are. Fighting off the crazy as best we can. Trying to become something better than we were. It's that second bit that's important." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Priscilla add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description:
"Something Vimes had learned as a young guard drifted up from memory. If you have to look along the shaft of an arrow from the wrong end, if a man has you entirely at his mercy, then hope like hell that man is an evil man. Because the evil like power, power over people, and they want to see you in fear. They want you to know you're going to die. So they'll talk. They'll gloat.
They'll watch you squirm. They'll put off the moment of murder like another man will put off a good cigar.
So hope like hell your captor is an evil man. A good man will kill you with hardly a word." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Priscilla add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family. " -- Jim Butcher
